attributes.action: Premier league clubs to provide funding for their local playing fields
attributes.additional_details:
Premier league football clubs to provide additional funding to improve and maintain local playing fields in their area to give the children that the clubs themselves scout to play for them every chance to improve and grow as footballers. Top flight clubs can earn millions out of home grown players out of sponsership and image rights. More and more young players are being bought for big fees from abroad and bypassing the possibility of a future international star we should be investing in British children at all levels of Amature football.
Our grass roots footballing facilities and playing surfaces in most parts of the country are nothing more than recreation grounds with a shipping container used for changing and storage of equipment. Yet premier league clubs are happy to send scouts to local parks to deliver talented young players and dismiss them after a stint in the clubs academy.  We must invest at ground level to give children a real chance of fulfilling thier dreams.

rejection.details: One for the Football Association/Premier League.
